messages.content: ComfyUi-NoodleWebcam is a node in ComfyUI that records frames from a webcam and sends them to other nodes for processing.
What settings can be adjusted in the ComfyUi-NoodleWebcam node?
In the ComfyUi-NoodleWebcam node, you can select the webcam, set the frame rate, and set the duration of the recording.
What are some known issues with the ComfyUi-NoodleWebcam node?

The ComfyUi-NoodleWebcam node has several known issues, such as requiring a change in framerate or duration to restart, randomly crashing and needing a restart of ComfyUI, not returning the correct preview, and frequent crashes.
What are some example outputs of the ComfyUi-NoodleWebcam node?
Example outputs of the ComfyUi-NoodleWebcam node include using it with OpenPoseDW Controlnet, Depth Controlnet, and Depth Controlnet with the invert node on.
What custom nodes are needed to use ComfyUi-NoodleWebcam?
To use ComfyUi-NoodleWebcam, you need the following custom nodes: AnimateDiff Evolved, pythongosssss ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts, MTB Nodes, ComfyUI FizzNodes, and ComfyUI Advanced ControlNet.
To install ComfyUi-NoodleWebcam, clone the repository inside your ComfyUI's custom_nodes folder.
What are some planned improvements for ComfyUi-NoodleWebcam?
Planned improvements for ComfyUi-NoodleWebcam include fixing the known bugs and implementing continuous streaming.
